What about the use of PFAS and other per/poly fluorinated substances in paper packaging like ice cream containers? PFAS are forever chemicals that don't easily leave the body and have been linked to multiple organ system disorders and are known endocrine disruptors. These substances are used in non-stick coatings and also coatings on paper products that make them waterproof and resistant to fats and oils (like those found in ice cream). What plans does Ben & Jerry's have to lessen the impact PFAS have on human health and the environment?
